>So said J. B. Rainsberger on 2003-07-22 --------------------
>>So said suy=
ash_says on 2003-07-22 --------------------
>>
>>   Hello every one. !!!
>>=
            Pls help me. i want to run the same testcase with 20 
>>differe=
nt set of values of an arg that gives me 20 unique results. I 
>>don't want=
 to hard code these values. Is there some dynamic way to do 
>>so that does=
n't increase overheades of writing test case.
>>                           =
         Regds
>>                                             - Suyash
>
>Y=
es, there is. Here is a sketch of the solution.
>
>1. Add a constructor to =
your TestCase subclass that accepts the parameters
>you want to use for eac=
h test. Store those parameters in the test fixture
>(instance variables).
>=
2. Create ONE test method that uses the test fixture and runs the test.
>3.=
 Create a suite() method that loops through your test data and uses your
>n=
ew constructor to push test data into the test fixture.

I forgot one thing=
:

4. Your constructor must call super("testMethodName"); before setting th=
e test fixture. The parameter to super() must match your test method name. =
You do not have to call the test method 'test*'. It just has to take no par=
ameters and return no value.
